Carlos Gomez.description: taking a break and going for a walk in nature (conversing about innovative ways to promote diversity and inclusion in their upcoming projects by involving Black LGBTQ+ activists, prioritizing accessibility options, collaborating with local Black artists and musicians, addressing unconscious bias and microaggressions, actively listening to marginalized communities, hosting workshops on allyship and privilege, involving young aspiring poets from diverse backgrounds, organizing a poetry reading event with multilingual readings and cultural performances, including Black-owned businesses, addressing systemic inequalities and racism, collaborating with LGBTQ+ organizations, engaging the student community and media, and planning mentorship opportunities for young Black leaders.) @ the Ville:Johnson Park:park:park garden

(conversing about how to further amplify marginalized voices by collaborating with Black-owned businesses, highlighting Black LGBTQ+ individuals, involving diverse youth in event planning, providing resources and support, addressing unconscious bias and microaggressions, incorporating Black music genres and literature, showcasing local Black artists, offering educational resources on Black history and contributions, collaborating with community leaders and activists, providing mentorship for young Black individuals, planning workshops on allyship and privilege, working with educational institutions, addressing systemic racism, and recognizing intersectionality in promoting diversity and inclusion.) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:library:library table
